data.constraints:
2 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 100
The Pokemon types are all {{Fire}}, {{Water}}, or {{Grass}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loopline N type:word(5)
write winner
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] - the number of Pokemon.
<<Line 2:>> [[N]] space separated strings - the types of the Pokemon.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> {{Fire}}, {{Water}}, or {{Grass}} - the type of the last remaining Pokemon

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

There are N Pokemon in a line. All of the Pokemon are Fire, Water, or Grass type.

The winner of a battle between two Pokemon depends on their types:
- Water wins against Fire
- Fire wins against Grass
- Grass wins against Water
- If the Pokemon are of the same type, either one can win.

Now, we will repeat the following procedure until there is only one Pokemon left in the line:
- The two leftmost Pokemon in the line start a battle. The winner stays in the line while the loser disappears.

What is the type of the last remaining Pokemon?
Input
Line 1: An integer N - the number of Pokemon.
Line 2: N space separated strings - the types of the Pokemon.
Output
Line 1: Fire, Water, or Grass - the type of the last remaining Pokemon
Constraints
2 ≤ N ≤ 100
The Pokemon types are all Fire, Water, or Grass.
Example
Input
2
Water Fire
Output
Water
